Job Description: Job Description, , PPLE is looking for tutors who have an interdisciplinary background, can teach multiple classes within the first and possibly the second and third year in the relevant Majors, and are willing to contribute to the PPLE community, as well as be actively involved in our programmes extracurricular activities, , PPLE College follows the UvAs 884 schedule or block system In the 1st, 2nd, 4th and 5th block, students take two courses consecutively Per course they have 2x2 hours of lectures and 2x2 hours of tutorials per week During blocks 3 January and 6 June students take a 4 week course, , PPLE is a small scale and intensive programme Class sizes of the tutorials will not exceed 16 students and student attendance is mandatory By working together, students learn how to understand and apply course material as well as sharpen their writing, critical thinking and communication skills Tutorials therefore require the active involvement of each student PPLE College actively promotes the personal development of students and their academic competences, , In the first year, thematic courses are taught in period 1,2,4,5, the socalled Academic Core, these are flanked by research methods courses It is desirable that tutors of the academic core courses teach more than one course to ensure the coherence of the program A part of the group of tutors will also perform tasks in the area of student mentoring, , PPLE College uses a mentor system to help students with their academic progress and offer guidance throughout their degree As a core tutor, it is also a possibility to be a student mentor, , , , University of Amsterdam UvA, , , , If you are the successful tutor, you, , , , , , The successful tutor will be offered an initial employment contract for 6 months or one year, in principle ranging from 15,2 up to 26,6 hours per week 0,4  0,7 FTE Upon positive evaluation of the performance the contract may be extended by one or two more years Starting date is 1 January or February 2021, , The gross fulltime monthly salary will be in accordance with the salary scales for Teacher 4 at Dutch universities, salary scale 10 ranging from 2,790 to 4,402 gross per month fulltime equivalent Secondary benefits at Dutch universities are attractive and include 8 holiday pay and an 8,3 endofyear Bonus, , The Collective Labour Agreement cao of Dutch Universities is applicable, , , , , , With over 5,000 employees, 30,000 students and a budget of more than 600 million euros, the University of Amsterdam UvA is an intellectual hub within the Netherlands Teaching and research at the UvA are conducted within seven faculties Humanities, Social and Behavioural Sciences, Economics and Business, Law, Science, Medicine and Dentistry Housed on four city campuses in or near the heart of Amsterdam, where disciplines come together and interact, the faculties have close links with thousands of researchers and hundreds of institutions at home and abroad, , The UvAs students and employees are independent thinkers, competent rebels who dare to question dogmas and arent satisfied with easy answers and standard solutions To work at the UvA is to work in an independent, creative, innovative and international climate characterised by an open atmosphere and a genuine engagement with the city of Amsterdam and society, , , , , , The Amsterdam Law School of the University of Amsterdam prides itself on its international orientation and strong social commitment This is reflected by both its research and educational activities The Amsterdam Law School offers three Bachelors programmes, including the interdisciplinary Englishlanguage Bachelor Politics, Psychology, Law and Economics PPLE in cooperation with two other Faculties, as well as a variety of Masters programmes, several of which are taught exclusively in English ie International and European Law, European Private Law, International Criminal Law, and Law  Finance The Amsterdam Law School prepares students for a wide variety of legal careers including law firms, government, business and industry, the national and international judiciary, public service, human rights advocacy, and academia With 5000 students and over 450 staff members, it is one of the largest law faculties in the Netherlands

Are you an ambitious and outstanding scholar in the field of Digital Transformation and Future of work Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, , Location AMSTERDAM, 1, , , , We are searching for a passionate colleague to develop our research program related, to Digital Transformation and Future of work The position is for a tenure track assistant professor or associate professor, who will contribute to our ambition to be one of the top research and teaching groups in the field of digital innovation in the workplace For this particular opening we look for a candidate with an ambition to conduct toplevel research and teaching portfolio, with a clear focus on the consequences of digitalization for work at microlevel and with deep expertise with qualitative research methods, , We are looking for internationally oriented, ambitious and collegial scholars who share our passion for the field of digital innovation and will contribute to our research and teaching We welcome applications with a PhD in business administration, organizational sociology or related social science disciplines, , We seek to further increase our global visibility through toplevel research on, technology and work In terms of teaching, we offer a newly developed and challenging MSc Program in Digital Business and Innovation, with 150 new students in 2020 The program delivers indepth knowledge on Digital Innovation, based on fundamental theoretical perspectives and with a strong focus on implications for and collaboration with practice Furthermore, we offer courses on information systems, digital innovation, new ways of working, and qualitative research methods in the BSc programs in International Business Administration as well as the doctoral program of the School of Business and Economics All our teaching for the BSc IBA program, the MSc program and doctoral program is in English This position will involve, among others, teaching courses on qualitative research methods and new ways of working and organizing, , , , , , , , , , What are we offering, We offer challenging position in an international and ambitious research group, Depending on the candidate merits and career stage, the position may be filled as tenured assistant professor or associate professor The initial employment contract for assistant professors will be for a period of 6 years, with the possibility of obtaining a permanent position tenure The position involves research 40 and teaching 60, At the end of the second year a performance evaluation will take place The Tenure Track Committee will review your file including the evaluation and advice on the continuation of your tenure track In the fifth year, the Tenure Track Committee will review your file in order to decide upon the tenured assignment, based on the assessment criteria of the Tenure Track system SBE For associate professor tailored contract will be agreed upon, , Gross monthly salaries are based on qualifications and experience and are set in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement of the Dutch Universities, , Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good worklife balance, such as, , , , , , The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and groundbreaking research We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavour  from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences, , Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students We employ over 4,600 individuals The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdams Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research, , , We are an inclusive university community Diversity is one of our most important values We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences, , , The School of Business and Economics SBE provides highquality education and excellent research in business administration and economics with a focus on contributing to the social, economic and ecological challenges of our time Whether it is the use of robots in society or big data, labour market participation or flexibility in the labour market, traffic jams or the housing market, flash crashes in the stock market or choice behaviour in gambling, leadership or change management we believe in goaloriented scientific research and understand that progress in academics, the business community and society is achieved through cooperation, openness and social responsibility, , At SBE, all of our highlymotivated colleagues work together closely in a stimulating, dynamic and international environment to achieve our collective goal of encouraging society to make informed choices Approximately 4,200 Bachelors and Masters students and 1,700 executive students are enrolled at the School, and employs roughly 500 people, , , , The KIN Center for Digital Innovation wwwsbevunlkin is a multidisciplinary research institute on digital innovation and is part of the School of Business and Economics of the VU University of Amsterdam We are an international group of 35 researchers studying the ways in which the use and development of digital innovations affect the way we work and organize The group is very well connected to both the academic and private and public organizations Our research is characterized by a practicebased approach and by its close collaboration with many business partners and researchers from other institutes On top of delivering top quality teaching and research, the KIN Center for Digital Innovation is creating a platform for collaboration with private and public organizations, offering various forms of executive education, research collaboration and knowledge sharing sessions for business partners, , Application, , Are you interested in this position Please apply via the application button and upload your curriculum vitae including your publications, a personal vision statement  1 page about research and teaching, and cover letter until, We start inviting candidates from the application deadline onwards and the search will continue until the positions has been filled with a highquality candidate, , , , , If you have any questions regarding this vacancy, you may contact, , Name Anastasia Sergeeva, Position Associate professor, Email asergeevavunl

Maastricht Universitys Faculty of Science and Engineering is happy to welcome a new colleague on the level of full professor who will further strengthen the innovative profile of Maastricht University in the STEM domain, specifically in the field of circular horticulture systems, , , , The Faculty of Science and Engineering of Maastricht University is founding, together with its partners, an innovative research institute in Future Farming at the Brightlands Greenport Campus Venlo The Brightlands Future of Farming Institute covers areas from plant functional genomics and plant envirogenetics to sustainable plant farming systems At this moment, we are especially looking for experts in the field of sustainable plant farming systems to become founding full professors at this new institute The founding professors will contribute to determining the future course of the institute, overseeing the recruitment of additional talented staff and guiding the development of new dedicated facilities on the campus The area of circular horticulture systems is broadly defined and encompasses specialisations such as vertical farming, greenhouse engineering, and sustainable outdoor farming, advanced sensing and lighting, autonomous growth systems as well as data science and AI for growing systems If you have expertise in one or more of these areas and you are looking for an exciting new opportunity to develop and conduct academic research and teaching as founding professor, you are encouraged to apply, , This position as full professor at the Brightlands Future of Farming Institute provides unique opportunities to develop new research lines and collaborate with relevant stakeholders Because of the unique location in the Brightlands ecosystem at the heart of one of the major European hightech vegetable growing areas, there is an optimal connection with startup and scaleup companies on the campus Furthermore, there are excellent opportunities for collaboration with other Maastricht University academic institutes at our Brightlands campuses in Maastricht, SittardGeleen and Heerlen As the institute is currently being developed, the candidates are expected to contribute to the optimal design of the laboratory, greenhouse and climate room conditions Since we value education very much at the Faculty of Science and Engineering of Maastricht University, additional experience and interest in academic teaching is important Candidates are expected to contribute to the development and execution of new courses and educational programmes in their area of The Chair International Development Studies IDS is one of the core Chairs at the Department of Human Geography, Planning and International Development Studies in the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences of the University of Amsterdam The position of full professor in International Development Studies will become available July 2021 The Chair International Development Studies will be located in the Governance and Inclusive Development GID programme group which is currently led by Joyeeta Gupta, Professor on Environment and Development in the Global South International Development Studies at the UVA has recently been ranked as 17th worldwide QS World University Rankings The new professor will be expected to bring in additional expertise in International Development Studies and preferably experience in Africa andor Asia The professor needs to be well versed in mixed methods, combining quantitative, qualitative, and spatial analysis In particular, we are looking for a professor who is skilled in quantitative methods The candidates work should fit in a social science environment and a department where IDS interacts closely with Geography and Planning, , The Governance and Inclusive Development programme group is actively developing the theoretical concepts of governance and inclusive development It aims to understand how development processes may need to be transformed in order to function within planetary boundaries while promoting socioenvironmental justice for all In particular, the research and teaching programme of the GID programme group focuses on socioeconomic, political and environmental transformations in the Global North and the Global South, in relations between the Global North and the Global South and especially questions the underlying discourses and structures that perpetuate persistent inequalities at multiple scales and locations It places an active emphasis on bringing together epistemologies, knowledge and perspectives from the North and the South GID has expertise on development challenges in relation to issues such as food and water security in relation to the governance of land, water, oceans, and climate change in relation to rural and urban governance at multiple levels of formal and informal governance and on education in postconflict countries All these research themes are embedded within a broader emphasis on poverty, inequality, socialenvironmental justice and a gender sensitive approach GID also hosts the Centre for Sustainable Development Studies which holds a conference every two years on Critical and Constructive Perspectives on the Sustainable Development Goals GID also leads the Maritime Research Centre MARE and hosts a Maritime conference every two years The GID group brings an interdisciplinary team of researchers and teachers together, , We are looking for a professor who is willing to further develop the research and teaching ambitions of the group while also having a specific niche of expertise We are looking for someone who is willing to actively, critically and constructively engage with the Sustainable Development Goals as they pertain to both the Global North and Global South, with the concept of inclusive development and has a specific niche area in which he or she is a globally recognized scholar We are looking for both an academic leader and a team player We are also looking for someone with a proven track record of project acquisition from a network of funding agencies, and who has an impressive set of PhD supervisions successfully completed, , The professor will also have to spend a substantial proportion of hisher time in teaching In the department, professors have to teach a minimum of 30 percent of their time Teaching skills are thus critical, , The teaching programme, which is one of the largest IDS programmes in the Netherlands, provides a Master and a Research Master degree, and offers courses at the Bachelor level in the Geography and Planning programme Through strong links with international research networks, policy departments and organizations of development practice, the group provides a strong interdisciplinary context for combining research and teaching The GID group also teaches in other MSc programmes within the department of Human Geography, Planning and International Development Studies, , The full profile of the Chair International Development Studies is available on request, , This link refers to the bachelor programme Sociale Geografie en Planologie, , The following links refer to the research master programmes, , , , The professor will be responsible for teaching different courses in IDS This may be either in the oneyear Master IDS, the twoyear Research Master IDS programmes or as part of the Minor IDS advanced bachelor level courses This also includes supervising Masters theses including fieldwork, and providing locations for such Masters theses fieldwork The professor may also be asked to contribute to the teaching programme in the Bachelor and Master programme of Human Geography and Urban and Regional Planning, and other programmes in the College of Social Sciences and the Graduate School of Social Sciences within the University, , The professor will be committed to the concepts of governance and inclusive development, and the groups ambitions via the Centre for Sustainable Development Studies The professor will develop ambitious research projects, and seek funding for these, in order to ensure the financial viability of the programme The professor will undertake and accomplish research in the field of IDS, publish in international refereed journals, and produce edited volumes and monographs published by international academic publishers Heshe is expected to take an active role in supervising PhDs and in the acquisition of external funding for research including PhD research A proven expertise in field research in the Global South is a necessary requirement Knowledge and use of a spatial relational perspective is an advantage, , The professor is expected to contribute to the management of the GID research group and the Department of Human Geography, Planning and International Development Studies and has to be prepared to take on such tasks as might be required for a full participation of the group in the activities of the University and the strategic networks linked to the IDSGID group Therefore, a good record of or potential for academic leadership is indispensable, , The professor has a responsibility to participate in the wider societal debates, connecting academic research to development policy and practice, , , , The full professor has, , Further information, , For more information about the position, please contact, , , , , , , The Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences FMG is the largest social science education and research institution in the Netherlands The Faculty serves approximately 9,000 students in numerous Bachelors and Masters programmes in Political Science, Sociology, Anthropology, Communication Science, Psychology, Human Geography, Urban and Regional Planning, International Development Studies and Educational Sciences The academic staff is employed in education as well as in research There are over 1,200 employees at the Faculty, located in a number of buildings in the centre of Amsterdam, , The Department of Human Geography, Planning and International Development Studies is one of the seven departments in the FMG Research and education are carried out by special institutes The Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research AISSR is responsible for research in the Social Sciences The College of Social Sciences CSS and the Graduate School of Social Sciences GSSS are responsible for undergraduate and graduate teaching programmes in the Social Sciences, , Research and teaching in the Department of Human Geography, Planning and International Development Studies is organized in four thematic programme groups Governance and Inclusive Development GID, Geographies of Globalizations GOG, Urban Geographies UG and Urban Planning UP, , Our offer, , The position concerns a fulltime employment for 38 hours per week Depending on qualifications and experience, the gross monthly salary will range from  5749 to  8371 based on fulltime employment for a 38hour working week in keeping with scale H2, as per the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities Secondary benefits at Dutch universities are attractive and include an 8 holiday allowance and an 83 end of year bonus, , Job application, , , , Applications should include, , At this stage of the procedure, please do not send letters of reference or proofs of your academic writing, , All documents should be sent, , The deadline for applications is 4 January 2021, , You may apply online by clicking on the link below

De Politieacademie bouwt aan nieuw basispolitieonderwijs en is daarom op zoek naar mensen die graag in teamverband onderwijs vernieuwen en ontwikkelen Wil jij samen met collegadocenten bijdragen aan de opleiding en startbekwaamheid van professionals die onze samenleving veilig houden Dan heten we jou van harte welkom als docent Integrale Beroepsvaardigheidstraining IBT bij de Politieacademie in Rotterdam, , Als docent IBT maak jij samen met je collegas het nieuwe politieonderwijs mogelijk Het belangrijkste uitgangspunt daarbij Dat je studenten ruimte geeft om zelf verantwoorde keuzes te maken in hun leerproces Je straalt vertrouwen uit en luistert goed naar wat jouw studenten inbrengen, meenemen, nodig hebben en vragen Hierop pas jij je onderwijs en begeleiding voortdurend aan Als docent ben je meer dan de begeleider van een leerproces jij bent in alles wat je doet en uitdraagt een voorbeeld voor je studenten Of liever gezegd je toekomstige politiecollegas, , Natuurlijk vindt leren niet alleen plaats in jouw lesruimte Politieagenten in de dop leren ook op hun werkplekken, op straat en online Aan jou en je collegas de taak om te zorgen dat studenten deze verschillende leeromgevingen als een gentegreerd geheel ervaren, gericht op n doel bedreven raken in goed politiewerk Het boeiende van jouw vak is dat je gemotiveerde studenten die aan het begin van hun politiecarrire staan, voorbereidt op heftige en gevaarlijke situaties die zij tijdens hun loopbaan kunnen tegenkomen Fysiek n mentaal Je leert ze omgaan met vuurwapens en zichzelf verdedigen En je coacht ze bijvoorbeeld ook in het werken onder hoge druk en stress Zo sta jij aan de basis van een nieuwe generatie van weerbare agenten, , Jouw hoofdtaken op een rij, , , Je komt te werken in het docententeam van de Politieacademie in Rotterdam Bij de samenstelling van docententeams zorgen we altijd voor een goede mix van kwaliteiten, kennis en ervaring, zowel op didactisch als politiekundig vlak Door te leren van en met je collegas, krijg jij de kans om verder te groeien in jouw docentschap Daarnaast kun je rekenen op goede ondersteuning van docentbegeleiders, , In de basis beschik jij over de competenties die bij jouw hoofdtaken als docent horen Dit betekent dat je maatschappelijk betrokken bent, jezelf goed mondeling kunt presenteren en goed in staat bent om studenten te coachen Ook ben je resultaatgericht, intercultureel sensitief en kun je goed samenwerken, , Verder heb je, , , De standplaats is Rotterdam Er is ruimte voor 1 fte Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van n jaar van toepassing is, , Verder kun je het volgende van Job Title: Assistant Professor in Health Professions Education
Job Description: Je verantwoordelijkheden liggen primair op het vlak onderwijsonderzoek, daarin geef je tevens advies en training Op deze manier draag je bij aan innovatie in het gezamenlijk opleiden van zorgprofessionals van de toekomst in het UMC Utrecht Het onderzoek is dan ook afgestemd op de strategie van het UMCU, Connecting worlds, de onderwijs en innovatiestrategie van het Onderwijscentrum en Fit voor de Future met de nieuwe Utrechtse school httpswwwumcutrechtnlnlonderwijsstrategie Je hebt een proactieve instelling en het vermogen om zowel zeer zelfstandig als in teamverband te werken Je bent goed thuis in onderwijswetenschappelijke literatuur en hebt uitstekende kennis en vaardigheden in statistiek en kwalitatieve en kwantitatieve onderzoeksmethoden Je voornaamste taken zijn werving, opzetten, uitvoering en disseminatie mondeling en schriftelijk van onderwijsonderzoek gericht op onderwijsinnovaties Adviseren, trainen en opleiden van junioronderzoekers en teaching scholars Daarnaast houd je je bezig met begeleiding en cordinatie van onderzoek en onderwijs, maar ook training en advies aan junior onderzoekers en teaching scholars Je initieert onderzoek en werkt samen in internationale netwerken De verdeling van percentage werktijd over dergelijke taken is flexibel en zal gemiddeld neerkomen op 40 onderzoek, 40 advies, onderwijs en training, 20 cordinatie van onderzoek en training, , Afdeling, , De standplaats van de positie is het Onderwijscentrum van het UMC Utrecht en daarbinnen het Expertisecentrum voor onderwijs en opleidingen, bij de leerstoel Research and Development of Health Professions Education De leerstoel wordt vertegenwoordigd door prof dr MF van der Schaaf, hoogleraar Research and Development of Health Professions Education en directeur van het Center for Research and Development of Education De focus van deze leerstoel ligt op adaptieve expertiseontwikkeling van professionals en relevante mechanismen en innovaties daarvoor, zoals feedback uit de omgeving of data Vanuit deze positie werk je samen met andere afdelingen en onderwijsleerstoelen in het Onderwijscentrum en in divisies in het UMCU, evenals met de Universiteit Utrecht Samenwerken en innoveren vanuit onderwijskwaliteit zijn dan ook centrale themas Als Expertisecentrum hebben wij de taak een wezenlijke bijdrage te leveren aan de ambities van het UMC Utrecht op het terrein van onderwijs en opleiden Dit geven we gestalte door advies en training over en het ontwerpen van methoden voor onderwijs en toetsing, curriculumontwikkeling, professionalisering van docenten, onderwijskundige scholing van studenten en assistenten in opleiding, onderzoek van onderwijs, ontwikkeling van onderwijstechnologie en kwaliteitszorg ten behoeve van onderwijs en opleiden Je komt terecht in een afwisselende inspirerende werkomgeving met een groot netwerk en ruimte voor eigen ontwikkeling, , Profiel, , Je bent een gepromoveerd en ervaren onderwijswetenschapper of aanverwant met bijbehorende trackrecord Je hebt stateoftheart expertise en een innovatieve visie op health professions education, het opleiden en trainen van toekomstige zorgprofessionals en het doen van onderzoek daarnaar Je bent een proactieve onderwijsvernieuwer met sterke methodologische kennis en vaardigheden, hebt grondige expertise in kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve methoden van onderzoek en het trainen en begeleiden van professionals en onderzoekers daarin Je bent breed inzetbaar op en hebt ervaring met het zelfstandig begeleiden van en verzorgen van onderwijs aan medeonderzoekers waaronder promovendi en het schrijven van aanvragen voor onderzoeks en onderwijsinnovatie subsidies Naast het hebben van een dienstverlenende en klantvriendelijke instelling ben je flexibel, nauwkeurig en planmatig Voor deze functie zoeken wij een onderzoeker met vaardigheden in het geven van advies en training, die bij voorkeur is gepromoveerd in de onderwijswetenschappen of een aanverwante discipline met specifieke interesse en kennis in health professions education Daarnaast is het een pre als je ervaring hebt met het leiden van onderzoeksprojecten en projectmatig werken, maar met het begeleiden en trainen van onderzoekers en professionals Je bezit uitstekende analytische eigenschappen en werkt nauwkeurig Bij voorkeur kan je vernieuwingen ontwerpen en implementeren gericht op leren op de werkplek en heb je ervaring en uitstekende kennis van statistiek en kwalitatieve en kwantitatieve onderzoeksmethoden Je beheerst je Engels en Nederlands in mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatie zeer goed en hebt een proactieve enthousiaste instelling, waarbij je zowel zelfstandig als in groepsverband kan werken De sollicitatiegesprekken zullen plaatsvinden in de week van 4 januari, , Het salaris voor deze 28  32 uur functie bedraagt maximaal  5383,00 bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband werkweek van 36 uur, , Onze arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de Cao Universitair Medische Centra UMC Wij bieden onder andere een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3, vakantietoeslag, een reiskostenvergoeding woonwerkverkeer en diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden Bekijk onze arbeidsvoorwaarden en diverse extras, , Meer informatie, , Voor meer inhoudelijke informatie over deze vacature, neem contact op met de contactpersoon, Marieke van der Schaaf, directeur Expertisecentrum voor onderwijs en opleiding, telefoonnummer 0625710537, email mfvanderschaaf5umcutrechtnl, , Acquisitie nav deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld

Country Rwanda Application closing date Flexible Start date April 2021 if the situation allows it Duration 1224 Months Note that this position involves working across several districts of the country To travel to districts you would usually travel on local buses Travel within districts will usually be as a passenger on motorbike taxis Thousands of teachers around the world do not get the necessary training and support, and as a consequence pupils do not reach their full potential VSO is working to change this This program improves childrens foundational English and Mathematic skills across all government schools in one district and is part of the Building Learning Foundations program This program focuses on establishing solid foundations at the lower primary level in all of Rwandas statefunded primary schools Improvements in learner outcomes in the lower primary grades are intended to improve childrens learning achievement in higher grades and so increase equitable access to primary and secondary education for girls and boys across the country As a VSO volunteer, you will immerse yourself in a new culture, face fresh challenges and develop your expertise, and often also management skills while doing something truly fulfilling The local office or partners need will decide your exact job description Role overview The Teacher Educator will play a crucial role in VSOs teacher education project in Myanmar Based at an Education College, you will support teacher education reforms in Myanmar and build the capacity of local Teacher Educators TEs to deliver the new 4year preservice degree course The role will focus on inclusive teaching practices and, in particular, the access, participation and achievement of children with disabilities

Job Title: Lecturer/Senior Lecturer (2 positions) Center for Teaching and Learning
Job Description: The Center for Teaching and Learning CTL at Central European University CEU invites applications for two positions at the LecturerSenior Lecturer position It is anticipated that one appointment will be made at the rank of Lecturer and one appointment at the rank of Senior Lecturer, , We expect applicants with a PhD experience in working at an education department, center for teaching and learning, or similar unit and an excellent teaching record in higher education The lecturersenior lecturer will support CEU faculty and collaborate with them on contemporary, researchbased approaches to teaching and mentoring in undergraduate and graduate education They will teach courses in higher education pedagogy for CEU PhD students, as well as support doctoral students as they grow as future university teachers They will also be involved in mentoring CEU Global Teaching Fellows and other earlycareer teachers The Senior Lecturer should also have the ability, if required, to participate in the administration and collegial leadership of the CTL team develop and implement programs and initiatives advise university stakeholders on teaching and learningrelated issues and collaborate with other university faculty, units, and administrators The initial contract is for three years with the possibility of renewal for another 3 years

Job Title: Volunteer: Teaching and Sports Education in Fiji
Job Description: Location Suva or Pacific Harbour, Fiji, , Duration min 2 weeks placement, , Start Dates Project is ongoing, and you can join at any time, depending upon availability Placements start each Monday, ,  325 Euros per week, , Fee Includes all food, accommodation, airport pickup, predeparture  incountry support, orientation and all project related activities, , Does not Include flights, travel insurance, personal spending, visas and vaccinations, , This opportunity is designed to give you the contacts and experience to help further your career You are not replacing any member of staff, but helping alongside them, whilst learning new skills, , , , Suva, located on the southeast coast of Viti Levu, is the capital of the country and its most cosmopolitan city A harbour city built on the peninsula, Suva has approximately 86,000 inhabitants of European, Indian, Asian and Fijian background With a unique combination of nature and culture, Suva is a great place to enjoy fresh flora and perfect beaches as well as to explore Fijian arts, rituals and festivals, , Fijis adventure capital, Pacific Harbor, is located less than an hour drive from Suva and sits along a beautiful stretch of coastline on the Southeast coast of Viti Levu The area has a wellearned reputation among adrenaline lovers for its wide variety of activities including surfing, shark feeding and fourwheeldrive tours More laidback activities are also available for those who enjoy golf or fishing Pacific Harbours offers lush rainforests, rivers and waterfalls and a pristine 2 km beach looking across Beqa Island with its famous lagoon and fire walkers, , The goal of this project, which takes place in both Suva and Pacific Harbour is to coach children in various sports and create an impact on their physical and psychological health Sport has an important role in the development of young children, with great potential to affect their futureThrough recreational activities, you are encouraged to build a relationship with the children and create a fun and actionfilled program Make a difference in the lives of young people growing up in Fiji, learn about life as a teacher and contribute to educations role in achieving sustainable development, , Daily Life, , Your First week will be an introductory experience to the island, this is compulsory for all trips to Fiji, and is the best way to get to know the people, culture and nature before starting your volunteer experience, , Depending on your previous skills and experience, you might take part in all or parts of the program activities, such as teaching sports rules and the basics of different games, showing examples of sports, organizing sportsrelated activities, playing with the children and teaching respect and fair play, , You will have an opportunity to teach educationbased concepts to different age groups and different levels You are encouraged to be as creative as possible in the way you share your knowledge and express your interest and enthusiasm about sports The children in the nearby community come after school hours and are grouped in teams Together with a local coach, you will train and work with these young sportsmen, who might one day represent their country on an international level After the workouts, there is time to enjoy some refreshments together with your students, , Your daily schedule includes teaching and coaching during morning sports classes at the local school After lunch you will teach and coach in the Sport Academy in the village The day will end with delicious dinner and time to relax at the centre and spend time with your fellow volunteers, , all information above is subject to change Please check the most up to date information on the Global Nomadic website when applying

PPLE College at the University of Amsterdam UvA offers an interdisciplinary, researchbased, English taught bachelor programme in Politics, Psychology, Law  Economics PPLE PPLE College is a collaborative effort by the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences, the Faculty of Economics and Business and the Amsterdam Law School, , , , PPLE College offers students an academic programme focused on the challenges science and society face at the intersections of its four disciplines PPLE students learn to analyse complex societal and organizational challenges through the integration of theories and methods from Politics, Psychology, Law and Economics, , PPLE is a selective honours programme Prospective students are selected to have a strong academic background, to be highly motivated and are from both the Netherlands and abroad The programme features an intensive tutoring system, inspiring educators and dedicated staff, , , , PPLE is looking for tutors who have an interdisciplinary background, can teach multiple classes within the first and possibly the second and third year in the relevant Majors, and are willing to contribute to the PPLE community, as well as be actively involved in our programmes extracurricular activities, , PPLE College follows the UvAs 884 schedule or block system In the 1st, 2nd, 4th and 5th block, students take two courses consecutively Per course they have 2x2 hours of lectures and 2x2 hours of tutorials per week During blocks 3 January and 6 June students take a 4 week course, , PPLE is a small scale and intensive programme Class sizes of the tutorials will not exceed 16 students and student attendance is mandatory By working together, students learn how to understand and apply course material as well as sharpen their writing, critical thinking and communication skills Tutorials therefore require the active involvement of each student PPLE College actively promotes the personal development of students and their academic competences, , In the first year, thematic courses are taught in period 1,2,4,5, the socalled Academic Core, these are flanked by research methods courses It is desirable that tutors of the academic core courses teach more than one course to ensure the coherence of the program A part of the group of tutors will also perform tasks in the area of student mentoring, , PPLE College uses a mentor system to help students with their academic progress and offer guidance throughout their degree As a core tutor, it is also a possibility to be a student mentor, , , , If you are the successful tutor, you, , , , , , , The successful tutor will be offered an initial employment contract for 6 months or one year, in principle ranging from 15,2 up to 26,6 hours per week 0,4  0,7 FTE Upon positive evaluation of the performance the contract may be extended by one or two more years Starting date is 1 January or February 2021, , The gross fulltime monthly salary will be in accordance with the salary scales for Teacher 4 at Dutch universities, salary scale 10 ranging from 2,790 to 4,402 gross per month fulltime equivalent Secondary benefits at Dutch universities are attractive and include 8 holiday pay and an 8,3 endofyear Bonus, , The Collective Labour Agreement cao of Dutch Universities is applicable

Excellent research assessments, the launch of three new MA programmes and growing student numbers enable the Department of Media Studies and Journalism to hire a lecturer to teach first and second year courses in the BA programme of Media Studies and to supervise BA theses Expertise in media, politics and democracy andor media theory is a competitive advantage, but the position is open to candidates with a wide range of research interests and theoretical and methodological expertise in media studies, , The international, Englishtaught BA programme in Media Studies focuses on the social and informative functions of media It is rooted in the humanities but also draws upon methods and paradigms developed in the social sciences and other disciplines The degree aims to provide students with a thorough understanding of the affordances of different platforms and the interplay between them the political and economic underpinnings of media systems patterns of use, production and content and the functions and impact of media in culture and society Throughout the curriculum, it provides a comparative perspective by studying media in their cultural, historical, economic, political and international contexts The programme has an annual enrolment of 120 students from all parts of the world, , Our BA programme ranks first among all Media Studies programmes in the Netherlands in the national student survey Teaching and supervision is in English
